title: Titans' field catches fire when flame machine malfunctions
text:
The Tennessee Titans‘ home opener didn’t get off to the safest start.

Reporters on the scene at Nissan Stadium in Nashville said the flame machine used for player introductions malfunctioned, causing a fire near the sideline.

No one was hurt by the fire and it was extinguished after a few minutes, reports said.

Titans’ pregame introduction flame machine malfunctioned shortly after the players took the field. They got the fire extinguished after a few minutes. No one was harmed. pic.twitter.com/2ciJDORWTn — Mike Jones (@ByMikeJones) September 15, 2019

The start of the Titans‘ game against the Indianapolis Colts was not significantly delayed.

description: At the Tennessee Titans' home opener, the flame machine used for player introductions malfunctioned, causing a fire near the sideline.
